title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.4 SOCIAL PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: 4.4 The Government has the capacity to provide efficient and effective social protection services to the most deprived girls and boys, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

sector.narrative: Policy and strategy development and coordination
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)

Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context) through technical assistance and/or funding

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.4 The Government has the capacity to provide efficient and effective social protection services to the most deprived girls andboys

description.narrative: Evidence-based policy recommendations and advocacy provided to the Government of Sri Lanka on social protection responses contributed to emergency cash transfers for majority of the population, while helping to solidify credibility of UNICEF in the area of social protection and starting a broader dialogue on universal child benefits. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2021

Social protection systems/programmes include emergency prevention prepardness and response(52799), Text

actual.value: 2021:In providing COVID-19 emergency cash transfers to households, the GoSL adapted its existing social protection programmes to reach households, with vertical and horizontal expansions. In 2021, the system was also utilized twice to provide cash to household
